markdownRemark.html:
I spent most of today traveling from Austin to New York City. Flights and Uber trips and crowds and constant motion. I am exhausted. How often do we feel exhausted when we are at work though? I know I feel pretty drained quite often when I am at work too.

Tonight, I had the option to say “I don’t really feel like writing anything. I don’t have any inspiration tonight.” But at work we don’t have the option of saying I’m tired, I can’t take care of that problem today. We always have to find a way to get the work done. And so tonight, I am writing something. It may not be very good, it may not be anything inspiring. But sometimes, all we can do is put the work in.

It’s not always going to be inspiring other people to do their best work. As a leader, you may have to step up and take care of things if others fall short. In these situations, all there is to do is shut up and do the work.

frontmatter.title: It's Not Always Inspirational
frontmatter.description: I talk a lot about inspiring others to do their best work, but as a leader it's not always about inspiring others. Sometimes we have to shut up and take care of business.
